alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 28 at 10:32PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of the western Piedmont of North Carolina, including the following county, Cabarrus. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1027 PM EST, the gauge on the Rocky Broad River above Irish Buffalo Creek was at 14.28 feet and steady. Reports indicated ongoing flooding due to runoff from heavy rain on Saturday and Saturday night. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Concord, Harrisburg and Mt Pleasant. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
